summary.long: Job is a book of the Old Testament.

verses.text: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job; and that man was perfect and upright, and one that feared God, and turned away from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And there were born unto him seven sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His substance also was seven thousand sheep, and three thousand camels, and five hundred yoke of oxen, and five hundred she-asses, and a very great household; so that this man was the greatest of all the children of the east.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And his sons went and held a feast in the house of each one upon his day; and they sent and called for their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was so, when the days of their feasting were gone about, that Job sent and sanctified them, and rose up early in the morning, and offered burnt-offerings according to the number of them all: for Job said, It may be that my sons have sinned, and renounced God in their hearts. Thus did Job continually.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now it came to pass on the day when the sons of God came to present themselves before Jehovah, that Satan also came among them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Satan, Whence comest thou? Then Satan answered Jehovah, and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Satan, Hast thou considered my servant Job? for there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one that feareth God, and turneth away from evil.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Satan answered Jehovah, and said, Doth Job fear God for nought?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Hast not thou made a hedge about him, and about his house, and about all that he hath, on every side? thou hast blessed the work of his hands, and his substance is increased in the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But put forth thy hand now, and touch all that he hath, and he will renounce thee to thy face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Satan, Behold, all that he hath is in thy power; only upon himself put not forth thy hand. So Satan went forth from the presence of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it fell on a day when his sons and his daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: that there came a messenger unto Job, and said, The oxen were plowing, and the asses feeding beside them;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and the Sabeans fell upon them, and took them away: yea, they have slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, The fire of God is fallen from heaven, and hath burned up the sheep and the servants, and consumed them; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, The Chaldeans made three bands, and fell upon the camels, and have taken them away, yea, and slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, Thy sons and thy daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and, behold, there came a great wind from the wilderness, and smote the four corners of the house, and it fell upon the young men, and they are dead; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job arose, and rent his robe, and shaved his head, and fell down upon the ground, and worshipped;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and he said, Naked came I out of my mother’s womb, and naked shall I return thither: Jehovah gave, and Jehovah hath taken away; blessed be the name of Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In all this Job sinned not, nor charged God foolishly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Again it came to pass on the day when the sons of God came to present themselves before Jehovah, that Satan came also among them to present himself before Jehovah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Satan, From whence comest thou? And Satan answered Jehovah, and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Satan, Hast thou considered my servant Job? for there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one that feareth God, and turneth away from evil: and he still holdeth fast his integrity, although thou movedst me against him, to destroy him without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Satan answered Jehovah, and said, Skin for skin, yea, all that a man hath will he give for his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But put forth thy hand now, and touch his bone and his flesh, and he will renounce thee to thy face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah said unto Satan, Behold, he is in thy hand; only spare his life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Satan went forth from the presence of Jehovah, and smote Job with sore boils from the sole of his foot unto his crown.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he took him a potsherd to scrape himself therewith; and he sat among the ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then said his wife unto him, Dost thou still hold fast thine integrity? renounce God, and die.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But he said unto her, Thou speakest as one of the foolish women speaketh. What? shall we receive good at the hand of God, and shall we not receive evil? In all this did not Job sin with his lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now when Job’s three friends heard of all this evil that was come upon him, they came every one from his own place: Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite; and they made an appointment together to come to bemoan him and to comfort him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when they lifted up their eyes afar off, and knew him not, they lifted up their voice, and wept; and they rent every one his robe, and sprinkled dust upon their heads toward heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So they sat down with him upon the ground seven days and seven nights, and none spake a word unto him: for they saw that his grief was very great.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Job answered and said:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let the day perish wherein I was born,
And the night which said, There is a man-child conceived.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Lo, let that night be barren;
Let no joyful voice come therein.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let them curse it that curse the day,
Who are ready to rouse up leviathan.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Because it shut not up the doors of my mother’s womb,
Nor hid trouble from mine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why died I not from the womb?
Why did I not give up the ghost when my mother bare me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why did the knees receive me?
Or why the breasts, that I should suck?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For now should I have lain down and been quiet;
I should have slept; then had I been at rest,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With kings and counsellors of the earth,
Who built up waste places for themselves;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or with princes that had gold,
Who filled their houses with silver:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or as a hidden untimely birth I had not been,
As infants that never saw light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There the wicked cease from troubling;
And there the weary are at rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There the prisoners are at ease together;
They hear not the voice of the taskmaster.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The small and the great are there:
And the servant is free from his master.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery,
And life unto the bitter in soul;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who long for death, but it cometh not,
And dig for it more than for hid treasures;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who rejoice exceedingly,
And are glad, when they can find the grave?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why is light given to a man whose way is hid,
And whom God hath hedged in?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For my sighing cometh before I eat,
And my groanings are poured out like water.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the thing which I fear cometh upon me,
And that which I am afraid of cometh unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am not at ease, neither am I quiet, neither have I rest;
But trouble cometh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If one assay to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved?
But who can withhold himself from speaking?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, thou hast instructed many,
And thou hast strengthened the weak hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy words have upholden him that was falling,
And thou hast made firm the feeble knees.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now it is come unto thee, and thou faintest;
It toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is not thy fear of God thy confidence,
And the integrity of thy ways thy hope?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent?
Or where were the upright cut off?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
According as I have seen, they that plow iniquity,
And sow trouble, reap the same.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the breath of God they perish,
And by the blast of his anger are they consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion,
And the teeth of the young lions, are broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The old lion perisheth for lack of prey,
And the whelps of the lioness are scattered abroad.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now a thing was secretly brought to me,
And mine ear received a whisper thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In thoughts from the visions of the night,
When deep sleep falleth on men,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Fear came upon me, and trembling,
Which made all my bones to shake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then a spirit passed before my face;
The hair of my flesh stood up.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Shall mortal man be more just than God?
Shall a man be more pure than his Maker?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, he putteth no trust in his servants;
And his angels he chargeth with folly:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much more them that dwell in houses of clay,
Whose foundation is in the dust,
Who are crushed before the moth!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Betwixt morning and evening they are destroyed:
They perish for ever without any regarding it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is not their tent-cord plucked up within them?
They die, and that without wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Call now; is there any that will answer thee?
And to which of the holy ones wilt thou turn?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For vexation killeth the foolish man,
And jealousy slayeth the silly one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have seen the foolish taking root:
But suddenly I cursed his habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His children are far from safety,
And they are crushed in the gate,
Neither is there any to deliver them:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For affliction cometh not forth from the dust,
Neither doth trouble spring out of the ground;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But man is born unto trouble,
As the sparks fly upward.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me, I would seek unto God,
And unto God would I commit my cause;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who doeth great things and unsearchable,
Marvellous things without number:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who giveth rain upon the earth,
And sendeth waters upon the fields;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that he setteth up on high those that are low,
And those that mourn are exalted to safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He frustrateth the devices of the crafty,
So that their hands cannot perform their enterprise.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He taketh the wise in their own craftiness;
And the counsel of the cunning is carried headlong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They meet with darkness in the day-time,
And grope at noonday as in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he saveth from the sword of their mouth,
Even the needy from the hand of the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So the poor hath hope,
And iniquity stoppeth her mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, happy is the man whom God correcteth:
Therefore despise not thou the chastening of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he maketh sore, and bindeth up;
He woundeth, and his hands make whole.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will deliver thee in six troubles;
Yea, in seven there shall no evil touch thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In famine he will redeem thee from death;
And in war from the power of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou shalt be hid from the scourge of the tongue;
Neither shalt thou be afraid of destruction when it cometh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
At destruction and dearth thou shalt laugh;
Neither shalt thou be afraid of the beasts of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou shalt be in league with the stones of the field;
And the beasts of the field shall be at peace with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And thou shalt know that thy tent is in peace;
And thou shalt visit thy fold, and shalt miss nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou shalt know also that thy seed shall be great,
And thine offspring as the grass of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou shalt come to thy grave in a full age,
Like as a shock of grain cometh in in its season.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lo this, we have searched it, so it is;
Hear it, and know thou it for thy good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that my vexation were but weighed,
And all my calamity laid in the balances!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For now it would be heavier than the sand of the seas:
Therefore have my words been rash.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the arrows of the Almighty are within me,
The poison whereof my spirit drinketh up:
The terrors of God do set themselves in array against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Doth the wild ass bray when he hath grass?
Or loweth the ox over his fodder?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can that which hath no savor be eaten without salt?
Or is there any taste in the white of an egg?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My soul refuseth to touch them;
They are as loathsome food to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that I might have my request;
And that God would grant me the thing that I long for!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even that it would please God to crush me;
That he would let loose his hand, and cut me off!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And be it still my consolation,
Yea, let me exult in pain that spareth not,
That I have not denied the words of the Holy One.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What is my strength, that I should wait?
And what is mine end, that I should be patient?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is my strength the strength of stones?
Or is my flesh of brass?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it not that I have no help in me,
And that wisdom is driven quite from me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To him that is ready to faint kindness should be showed from his friend;
Even to him that forsaketh the fear of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My brethren have dealt deceitfully as a brook,
As the channel of brooks that pass away;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Which are black by reason of the ice,
And wherein the snow hideth itself:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What time they wax warm, they vanish;
When it is hot, they are consumed out of their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The caravans that travel by the way of them turn aside;
They go up into the waste, and perish.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The caravans of Tema looked,
The companies of Sheba waited for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They were put to shame because they had hoped;
They came thither, and were confounded.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For now ye are nothing;
Ye see a terror, and are afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Did I say, Give unto me?
Or, Offer a present for me of your substance?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or, Deliver me from the adversary’s hand?
Or, Redeem me from the hand of the oppressors?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach me, and I will hold my peace;
And cause me to understand wherein I have erred.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How forcible are words of uprightness!
But your reproof, what doth it reprove?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Do ye think to reprove words,
Seeing that the speeches of one that is desperate are as wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, ye would cast lots upon the fatherless,
And make merchandise of your friend.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Now therefore be pleased to look upon me;
For surely I shall not lie to your face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Return, I pray you, let there be no injustice;
Yea, return again, my cause is righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there injustice on my tongue?
Cannot my taste discern mischievous things?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there not a warfare to man upon earth?
And are not his days like the days of a hireling?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As a servant that earnestly desireth the shadow,
And as a hireling that looketh for his wages:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So am I made to possess months of misery,
And wearisome nights are appointed to me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I lie down, I say,
When shall I arise, and the night be gone?
And I am full of tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust;
My skin closeth up, and breaketh out afresh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My days are swifter than a weaver’s shuttle,
And are spent without hope.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh remember that my life is a breath:
Mine eye shall no more see good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eye of him that seeth me shall behold me no more;
Thine eyes shall be upon me, but I shall not be.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away,
So he that goeth down to Sheol shall come up no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall return no more to his house,
Neither shall his place know him any more.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Am I a sea, or a sea-monster,
That thou settest a watch over me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I say, My bed shall comfort me,
My couch shall ease my complaint;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then thou scarest me with dreams,
And terrifiest me through visions:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that my soul chooseth strangling,
And death rather than these my bones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I loathe my life; I would not live alway:
Let me alone; for my days are vanity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What is man, that thou shouldest magnify him,
And that thou shouldest set thy mind upon him,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And that thou shouldest visit him every morning,
And try him every moment?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long wilt thou not look away from me,
Nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have sinned, what do I unto thee, O thou watcher of men?
Why hast thou set me as a mark for thee,
So that I am a burden to myself?
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long wilt thou speak these things?
And how long shall the words of thy mouth be like a mighty wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Doth God pervert justice?
Or doth the Almighty pervert righteousness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thy children have sinned against him,
And he hath delivered them into the hand of their transgression;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thou wouldest seek diligently unto God,
And make thy supplication to the Almighty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thou wert pure and upright:
Surely now he would awake for thee,
And make the habitation of thy righteousness prosperous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And though thy beginning was small,
Yet thy latter end would greatly increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For inquire, I pray thee, of the former age,
And apply thyself to that which their fathers have searched out
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(For we are but of yesterday, and know nothing,
Because our days upon earth are a shadow);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall not they teach thee, and tell thee,
And utter words out of their heart?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can the rush grow up without mire?
Can the flag grow without water?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whilst it is yet in its greenness, and not cut down,
It withereth before any other herb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So are the paths of all that forget God;
And the hope of the godless man shall perish:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whose confidence shall break in sunder,
And whose trust is a spider’s web.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall lean upon his house, but it shall not stand:
He shall hold fast thereby, but it shall not endure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is green before the sun,
And his shoots go forth over his garden.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His roots are wrapped about the stone-heap,
He beholdeth the place of stones.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If he be destroyed from his place,
Then it shall deny him, saying, I have not seen thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, this is the joy of his way;
And out of the earth shall others spring.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, God will not cast away a perfect man,
Neither will he uphold the evil-doers.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will yet fill thy mouth with laughter,
And thy lips with shouting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that hate thee shall be clothed with shame;
And the tent of the wicked shall be no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Of a truth I know that it is so:
But how can man be just with God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If he be pleased to contend with him,
He cannot answer him one of a thousand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is wise in heart, and mighty in strength:
Who hath hardened himself against him, and prospered?—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Him that removeth the mountains, and they know it not,
When he overturneth them in his anger;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That shaketh the earth out of its place,
And the pillars thereof tremble;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That commandeth the sun, and it riseth not,
And sealeth up the stars;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That alone stretcheth out the heavens,
And treadeth upon the waves of the sea;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That maketh the Bear, Orion, and the Pleiades,
And the chambers of the south;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That doeth great things past finding out,
Yea, marvellous things without number.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lo, he goeth by me, and I see him not:
He passeth on also, but I perceive him not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, he seizeth the prey, who can hinder him?
Who will say unto him, What doest thou?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God will not withdraw his anger;
The helpers of Rahab do stoop under him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much less shall I answer him,
And choose out my words to reason with him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whom, though I were righteous, yet would I not answer;
I would make supplication to my judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I had called, and he had answered me,
Yet would I not believe that he hearkened unto my voice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he breaketh me with a tempest,
And multiplieth my wounds without cause.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will not suffer me to take my breath,
But filleth me with bitterness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If we speak of strength, lo, he is mighty!
And if of justice, Who, saith he, will summon me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I be righteous, mine own mouth shall condemn me:
Though I be perfect, it shall prove me perverse.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am perfect; I regard not myself;
I despise my life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is all one; therefore I say,
He destroyeth the perfect and the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If the scourge slay suddenly,
He will mock at the trial of the innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Now my days are swifter than a post:
They flee away, they see no good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are passed away as the swift ships;
As the eagle that swoopeth on the prey.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I say, I will forget my complaint,
I will put off my sad countenance, and be of good cheer;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am afraid of all my sorrows,
I know that thou wilt not hold me innocent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I shall be condemned;
Why then do I labor in vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I wash myself with snow water,
And make my hands never so clean;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet wilt thou plunge me in the ditch,
And mine own clothes shall abhor me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he is not a man, as I am, that I should answer him,
That we should come together in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no umpire betwixt us,
That might lay his hand upon us both.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let him take his rod away from me,
And let not his terror make me afraid:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then would I speak, and not fear him;
For I am not so in myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I will say unto God, Do not condemn me;
Show me wherefore thou contendest with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress,
That thou shouldest despise the work of thy hands,
And shine upon the counsel of the wicked?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hast thou eyes of flesh?
Or seest thou as man seeth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are thy days as the days of man,
Or thy years as man’s days,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That thou inquirest after mine iniquity,
And searchest after my sin,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Although thou knowest that I am not wicked,
And there is none that can deliver out of thy hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy hands have framed me and fashioned me
Together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast fashioned me as clay;
And wilt thou bring me into dust again?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hast thou not poured me out as milk,
And curdled me like cheese?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh,
And knit me together with bones and sinews.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast granted me life and lovingkindness;
And thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet these things thou didst hide in thy heart;
I know that this is with thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I sin, then thou markest me,
And thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And if my head exalt itself, thou huntest me as a lion;
And again thou showest thyself marvellous upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou renewest thy witnesses against me,
And increasest thine indignation upon me:
Changes and warfare are with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb?
I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I should have been as though I had not been;
I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are not my days few? cease then,
And let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Before I go whence I shall not return,
Even to the land of darkness and of the shadow of death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The land dark as midnight,
The land of the shadow of death, without any order,
And where the light is as midnight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should not the multitude of words be answered?
And should a man full of talk be justified?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should thy boastings make men hold their peace?
And when thou mockest, shall no man make thee ashamed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou sayest, My doctrine is pure,
And I am clean in thine eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But oh that God would speak,
And open his lips against thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And that he would show thee the secrets of wisdom!
For he is manifold in understanding.
Know therefore that God exacteth of thee less than thine iniquity deserveth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canst thou by searching find out God?
Canst thou find out the Almighty unto perfection?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is high as heaven; what canst thou do?
Deeper than Sheol; what canst thou know?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The measure thereof is longer than the earth,
And broader than the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If he pass through, and shut up,
And all unto judgment, then who can hinder him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he knoweth false men:
He seeth iniquity also, even though he consider it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But vain man is void of understanding,
Yea, man is born as a wild ass’s colt.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thou set thy heart aright,
And stretch out thy hands toward him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If iniquity be in thy hand, put it far away,
And let not unrighteousness dwell in thy tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot;
Yea, thou shalt be stedfast, and shalt not fear:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou shalt forget thy misery;
Thou shalt remember it as waters that are passed away,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And thy life shall be clearer than the noonday;
Though there be darkness, it shall be as the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And thou shalt be secure, because there is hope;
Yea, thou shalt search about thee, and shalt take thy rest in safety.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Also thou shalt lie down, and none shall make thee afraid;
Yea, many shall make suit unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No doubt but ye are the people,
And wisdom shall die with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I am as one that is a laughing-stock to his neighbor,
I who called upon God, and he answered:
The just, the perfect man is a laughing-stock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the thought of him that is at ease there is contempt for misfortune;
It is ready for them whose foot slippeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee;
And the birds of the heavens, and they shall tell thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee;
And the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who knoweth not in all these,
That the hand of Jehovah hath wrought this,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In whose hand is the soul of every living thing,
And the breath of all mankind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Doth not the ear try words,
Even as the palate tasteth its food?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With aged men is wisdom,
And in length of days understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With God is wisdom and might;
He hath counsel and understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again;
He shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up;
Again, he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With him is strength and wisdom;
The deceived and the deceiver are his.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He leadeth counsellors away stripped,
And judges maketh he fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He looseth the bond of kings,
And he bindeth their loins with a girdle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He leadeth priests away stripped,
And overthroweth the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He removeth the speech of the trusty,
And taketh away the understanding of the elders.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He poureth contempt upon princes,
And looseth the belt of the strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He uncovereth deep things out of darkness,
And bringeth out to light the shadow of death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He increaseth the nations, and he destroyeth them:
He enlargeth the nations, and he leadeth them captive.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He taketh away understanding from the chiefs of the people of the earth,
And causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They grope in the dark without light;
And he maketh them to stagger like a drunken man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lo, mine eye hath seen all this,
Mine ear hath heard and understood it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What ye know, the same do I know also:
I am not inferior unto you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely I would speak to the Almighty,
And I desire to reason with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But ye are forgers of lies;
Ye are all physicians of no value.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that ye would altogether hold your peace!
And it would be your wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear now my reasoning,
And hearken to the pleadings of my lips.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will ye speak unrighteously for God,
And talk deceitfully for him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will ye show partiality to him?
Will ye contend for God?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it good that he should search you out?
Or as one deceiveth a man, will ye deceive him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will surely reprove you,
If ye do secretly show partiality.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall not his majesty make you afraid,
And his dread fall upon you?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Your memorable sayings are proverbs of ashes,
Your defences are defences of clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak;
And let come on me what will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherefore should I take my flesh in my teeth,
And put my life in my hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, he will slay me; I have no hope:
Nevertheless I will maintain my ways before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This also shall be my salvation,
That a godless man shall not come before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear diligently my speech,
And let my declaration be in your ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold now, I have set my cause in order;
I know that I am righteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is he that will contend with me?
For then would I hold my peace and give up the ghost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Only do not two things unto me;
Then will I not hide myself from thy face:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Withdraw thy hand far from me;
And let not thy terror make me afraid.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then call thou, and I will answer;
Or let me speak, and answer thou me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How many are mine iniquities and sins?
Make me to know my transgression and my sin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherefore hidest thou thy face,
And holdest me for thine enemy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wilt thou harass a driven leaf?
And wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou writest bitter things against me,
And makest me to inherit the iniquities of my youth:
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Though I am like a rotten thing that consumeth,
Like a garment that is moth-eaten.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Man, that is born of a woman,
Is of few days, and full of trouble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down:
He fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And dost thou open thine eyes upon such a one,
And bringest me into judgment with thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Look away from him, that he may rest,
Till he shall accomplish, as a hireling, his day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For there is hope of a tree,
If it be cut down, that it will sprout again,
And that the tender branch thereof will not cease.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though the root thereof wax old in the earth,
And the stock thereof die in the ground;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet through the scent of water it will bud,
And put forth boughs like a plant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But man dieth, and is laid low:
Yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where is he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As the waters fail from the sea,
And the river wasteth and drieth up;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So man lieth down and riseth not:
Till the heavens be no more, they shall not awake,
Nor be roused out of their sleep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that thou wouldest hide me in Sheol,
That thou wouldest keep me secret, until thy wrath be past,
That thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If a man die, shall he live again?
All the days of my warfare would I wait,
Till my release should come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou wouldest call, and I would answer thee:
Thou wouldest have a desire to the work of thy hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now thou numberest my steps:
Dost thou not watch over my sin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My transgression is sealed up in a bag,
And thou fastenest up mine iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But the mountain falling cometh to nought;
And the rock is removed out of its place;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth;
Thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His sons come to honor, and he knoweth it not;
And they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But his flesh upon him hath pain,
And his soul within him mourneth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should a wise man make answer with vain knowledge,
And fill himself with the east wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Should he reason with unprofitable talk,
Or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, thou doest away with fear,
And hinderest devotion before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thine iniquity teacheth thy mouth,
And thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I;
Yea, thine own lips testify against thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Art thou the first man that was born?
Or wast thou brought forth before the hills?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hast thou heard the secret counsel of God?
And dost thou limit wisdom to thyself?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What knowest thou, that we know not?
What understandest thou, which is not in us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
With us are both the grayheaded and the very aged men,
Much elder than thy father.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Are the consolations of God too small for thee,
Even the word that is gentle toward thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why doth thy heart carry thee away?
And why do thine eyes flash,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That against God thou turnest thy spirit,
And lettest words go out of thy mouth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What is man, that he should be clean?
And he that is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, he putteth no trust in his holy ones;
Yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much less one that is abominable and corrupt,
A man that drinketh iniquity like water!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will show thee, hear thou me;
And that which I have seen I will declare
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(Which wise men have told
From their fathers, and have not hid it;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unto whom alone the land was given,
And no stranger passed among them):
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days,
Even the number of years that are laid up for the oppressor.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A sound of terrors is in his ears;
In prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness,
And he is waited for of the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it?
He knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Distress and anguish make him afraid;
They prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because he hath stretched out his hand against God,
And behaveth himself proudly against the Almighty;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He runneth upon him with a stiff neck,
With the thick bosses of his bucklers;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because he hath covered his face with his fatness,
And gathered fat upon his loins;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue,
Neither shall their possessions be extended on the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Let him not trust in vanity, deceiving himself;
For vanity shall be his recompense.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall be accomplished before his time,
And his branch shall not be green.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine,
And shall cast off his flower as the olive-tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the company of the godless shall be barren,
And fire shall consume the tents of bribery.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They conceive mischief, and bring forth iniquity,
And their heart prepareth deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have heard many such things:
Miserable comforters are ye all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall vain words have an end?
Or what provoketh thee that thou answerest?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I also could speak as ye do;
If your soul were in my soul’s stead,
I could join words together against you,
And shake my head at you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But I would strengthen you with my mouth,
And the solace of my lips would assuage your grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though I speak, my grief is not assuaged;
And though I forbear, what am I eased?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now he hath made me weary:
Thou hast made desolate all my company.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And thou hast laid fast hold on me, which is a witness against me:
And my leanness riseth up against me,
It testifieth to my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God delivereth me to the ungodly,
And casteth me into the hands of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He breaketh me with breach upon breach;
He runneth upon me like a giant.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin,
And have laid my horn in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My face is red with weeping,
And on my eyelids is the shadow of death;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Although there is no violence in my hands,
And my prayer is pure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
O earth, cover not thou my blood,
And let my cry have no resting-place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even now, behold, my witness is in heaven,
And he that voucheth for me is on high.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My friends scoff at me:
But mine eye poureth out tears unto God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That he would maintain the right of a man with God,
And of a son of man with his neighbor!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For when a few years are come,
I shall go the way whence I shall not return.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My spirit is consumed, my days are extinct,
The grave is ready for me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely there are mockers with me,
And mine eye dwelleth upon their provocation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Give now a pledge, be surety for me with thyself;
Who is there that will strike hands with me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou hast hid their heart from understanding:
Therefore shalt thou not exalt them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He that denounceth his friends for a prey,
Even the eyes of his children shall fail.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he hath made me a byword of the people;
And they spit in my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow,
And all my members are as a shadow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Upright men shall be astonished at this,
And the innocent shall stir up himself against the godless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet shall the righteous hold on his way,
And he that hath clean hands shall wax stronger and stronger.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for you all, come on now again;
And I shall not find a wise man among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My days are past, my purposes are broken off,
Even the thoughts of my heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They change the night into day:
The light, say they, is near unto the darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I look for Sheol as my house;
If I have spread my couch in the darkness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have said to corruption, Thou art my father;
To the worm, Thou art my mother, and my sister;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where then is my hope?
And as for my hope, who shall see it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It shall go down to the bars of Sheol,
When once there is rest in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will ye hunt for words?
Consider, and afterwards we will speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherefore are we counted as beasts,
And are become unclean in your sight?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou that tearest thyself in thine anger,
Shall the earth be forsaken for thee?
Or shall the rock be removed out of its place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out,
And the spark of his fire shall not shine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The light shall be dark in his tent,
And his lamp above him shall be put out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The steps of his strength shall be straitened,
And his own counsel shall cast him down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he is cast into a net by his own feet,
And he walketh upon the toils.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A gin shall take him by the heel,
And a snare shall lay hold on him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
A noose is hid for him in the ground,
And a trap for him in the way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Terrors shall make him afraid on every side,
And shall chase him at his heels.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His strength shall be hunger-bitten,
And calamity shall be ready at his side.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The members of his body shall be devoured,
Yea, the first-born of death shall devour his members.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall be rooted out of his tent wherein he trusteth;
And he shall be brought to the king of terrors.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There shall dwell in his tent that which is none of his:
Brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His roots shall be dried up beneath,
And above shall his branch be cut off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His remembrance shall perish from the earth,
And he shall have no name in the street.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall be driven from light into darkness,
And chased out of the world.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall have neither son nor son’s son among his people,
Nor any remaining where he sojourned.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that come after shall be astonished at his day,
As they that went before were affrighted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely such are the dwellings of the unrighteous,
And this is the place of him that knoweth not God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How long will ye vex my soul,
And break me in pieces with words?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
These ten times have ye reproached me:
Ye are not ashamed that ye deal hardly with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And be it indeed that I have erred,
Mine error remaineth with myself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me,
And plead against me my reproach;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Know now that God hath subverted me in my cause,
And hath compassed me with his net.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard:
I cry for help, but there is no justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath walled up my way that I cannot pass,
And hath set darkness in my paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath stripped me of my glory,
And taken the crown from my head.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath broken me down on every side, and I am gone;
And my hope hath he plucked up like a tree.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath also kindled his wrath against me,
And he counteth me unto him as one of his adversaries.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His troops come on together,
And cast up their way against me,
And encamp round about my tent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath put my brethren far from me,
And mine acquaintance are wholly estranged from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My kinsfolk have failed,
And my familiar friends have forgotten me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that dwell in my house, and my maids, count me for a stranger:
I am an alien in their sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I call unto my servant, and he giveth me no answer,
Though I entreat him with my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My breath is strange to my wife,
And my supplication to the children of mine own mother.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even young children despise me;
If I arise, they speak against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All my familiar friends abhor me,
And they whom I loved are turned against me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh,
And I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends;
For the hand of God hath touched me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why do ye persecute me as God,
And are not satisfied with my flesh?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that my words were now written!
Oh that they were inscribed in a book!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That with an iron pen and lead
They were graven in the rock for ever!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for me I know that my Redeemer liveth,
And at last he will stand up upon the earth:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And after my skin, even this body, is destroyed,
Then without my flesh shall I see God;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whom I, even I, shall see, on my side,
And mine eyes shall behold, and not as a stranger.
My heart is consumed within me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If ye say, How we will persecute him!
And that the root of the matter is found in me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Be ye afraid of the sword:
For wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword,
That ye may know there is a judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore do my thoughts give answer to me,
Even by reason of my haste that is in me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have heard the reproof which putteth me to shame;
And the spirit of my understanding answereth me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Knowest thou not this of old time,
Since man was placed upon earth,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That the triumphing of the wicked is short,
And the joy of the godless but for a moment?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though his height mount up to the heavens,
And his head reach unto the clouds;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung:
They that have seen him shall say, Where is he?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found:
Yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The eye which saw him shall see him no more;
Neither shall his place any more behold him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His children shall seek the favor of the poor,
And his hands shall give back his wealth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His bones are full of his youth,
But it shall lie down with him in the dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth,
Though he hide it under his tongue,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though he spare it, and will not let it go,
But keep it still within his mouth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet his food in his bowels is turned,
It is the gall of asps within him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again;
God will cast them out of his belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall suck the poison of asps:
The viper’s tongue shall slay him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall not look upon the rivers,
The flowing streams of honey and butter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That which he labored for shall he restore, and shall not swallow it down;
According to the substance that he hath gotten, he shall not rejoice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he hath oppressed and forsaken the poor;
He hath violently taken away a house, and he shall not build it up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because he knew no quietness within him,
He shall not save aught of that wherein he delighteth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There was nothing left that he devoured not;
Therefore his prosperity shall not endure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits:
The hand of every one that is in misery shall come upon him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he is about to fill his belly, God will cast the fierceness of his wrath upon him,
And will rain it upon him while he is eating.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He shall flee from the iron weapon,
And the bow of brass shall strike him through.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The heavens shall reveal his iniquity,
And the earth shall rise up against him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The increase of his house shall depart;
His goods shall flow away in the day of his wrath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the portion of a wicked man from God,
And the heritage appointed unto him by God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear diligently my speech;
And let this be your consolations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Suffer me, and I also will speak;
And after that I have spoken, mock on.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As for me, is my complaint to man?
And why should I not be impatient?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mark me, and be astonished,
And lay your hand upon your mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even when I remember I am troubled,
And horror taketh hold on my flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherefore do the wicked live,
Become old, yea, wax mighty in power?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their seed is established with them in their sight,
And their offspring before their eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their houses are safe from fear,
Neither is the rod of God upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their bull gendereth, and faileth not;
Their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They send forth their little ones like a flock,
And their children dance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They sing to the timbrel and harp,
And rejoice at the sound of the pipe.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They spend their days in prosperity,
And in a moment they go down to Sheol.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they say unto God, Depart from us;
For we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What is the Almighty, that we should serve him?
And what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lo, their prosperity is not in their hand:
The counsel of the wicked is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How oft is it that the lamp of the wicked is put out?
That their calamity cometh upon them?
That God distributeth sorrows in his anger?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That they are as stubble before the wind,
And as chaff that the storm carrieth away?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Ye say, God layeth up his iniquity for his children.
Let him recompense it unto himself, that he may know it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let his own eyes see his destruction,
And let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For what careth he for his house after him,
When the number of his months is cut off?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall any teach God knowledge,
Seeing he judgeth those that are high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One dieth in his full strength,
Being wholly at ease and quiet:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His pails are full of milk,
And the marrow of his bones is moistened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And another dieth in bitterness of soul,
And never tasteth of good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They lie down alike in the dust,
And the worm covereth them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I know your thoughts,
And the devices wherewith ye would wrong me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For ye say, Where is the house of the prince?
And where is the tent wherein the wicked dwelt?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have ye not asked wayfaring men?
And do ye not know their evidences,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That the evil man is reserved to the day of calamity?
That they are led forth to the day of wrath?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who shall declare his way to his face?
And who shall repay him what he hath done?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet shall he be borne to the grave,
And men shall keep watch over the tomb.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him,
And all men shall draw after him,
As there were innumerable before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How then comfort ye me in vain,
Seeing in your answers there remaineth only falsehood?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Can a man be profitable unto God?
Surely he that is wise is profitable unto himself.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous?
Or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it for thy fear of him that he reproveth thee,
That he entereth with thee into judgment?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is not thy wickedness great?
Neither is there any end to thine iniquities.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For thou hast taken pledges of thy brother for nought,
And stripped the naked of their clothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink,
And thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But as for the mighty man, he had the earth;
And the honorable man, he dwelt in it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou hast sent widows away empty,
And the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore snares are round about thee,
And sudden fear troubleth thee,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or darkness, so that thou canst not see,
And abundance of waters cover thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is not God in the height of heaven?
And behold the height of the stars, how high they are!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And thou sayest, What doth God know?
Can he judge through the thick darkness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thick clouds are a covering to him, so that he seeth not;
And he walketh on the vault of heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wilt thou keep the old way
Which wicked men have trodden?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who were snatched away before their time,
Whose foundation was poured out as a stream,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who said unto God, Depart from us;
And, What can the Almighty do for us?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet he filled their houses with good things:
But the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The righteous see it, and are glad;
And the innocent laugh them to scorn,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Saying, Surely they that did rise up against us are cut off,
And the remnant of them the fire hath consumed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace:
Thereby good shall come unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth,
And lay up his words in thy heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up,
If thou put away unrighteousness far from thy tents.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And lay thou thy treasure in the dust,
And the gold of Ophir among the stones of the brooks;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And the Almighty will be thy treasure,
And precious silver unto thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For then shalt thou delight thyself in the Almighty,
And shalt lift up thy face unto God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he will hear thee;
And thou shalt pay thy vows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee;
And light shall shine upon thy ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they cast thee down, thou shalt say, There is lifting up;
And the humble person he will save.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He will deliver even him that is not innocent:
Yea, he shall be delivered through the cleanness of thy hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Even to-day is my complaint rebellious:
My stroke is heavier than my groaning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that I knew where I might find him!
That I might come even to his seat!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would set my cause in order before him,
And fill my mouth with arguments.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would know the words which he would answer me,
And understand what he would say unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Would he contend with me in the greatness of his power?
Nay; but he would give heed unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There the upright might reason with him;
So should I be delivered for ever from my judge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I go forward, but he is not there;
And backward, but I cannot perceive him;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the left hand, when he doth work, but I cannot behold him;
He hideth himself on the right hand, that I cannot see him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he knoweth the way that I take;
When he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My foot hath held fast to his steps;
His way have I kept, and turned not aside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I have not gone back from the commandment of his lips;
I have treasured up the words of his mouth more than my necessary food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But he is in one mind, and who can turn him?
And what his soul desireth, even that he doeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he performeth that which is appointed for me:
And many such things are with him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore am I terrified at his presence;
When I consider, I am afraid of him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God hath made my heart faint,
And the Almighty hath terrified me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because I was not cut off before the darkness,
Neither did he cover the thick darkness from my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why are times not laid up by the Almighty?
And why do not they that know him see his days?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are that remove the landmarks;
They violently take away flocks, and feed them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They drive away the ass of the fatherless;
They take the widow’s ox for a pledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They turn the needy out of the way:
The poor of the earth all hide themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They cut their provender in the field;
And they glean the vintage of the wicked.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They lie all night naked without clothing,
And have no covering in the cold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are wet with the showers of the mountains,
And embrace the rock for want of a shelter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There are that pluck the fatherless from the breast,
And take a pledge of the poor;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that they go about naked without clothing,
And being hungry they carry the sheaves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They make oil within the walls of these men;
They tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From out of the populous city men groan,
And the soul of the wounded crieth out:
Yet God regardeth not the folly.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight,
Saying, No eye shall see me:
And he disguiseth his face.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For the morning is to all of them as thick darkness;
For they know the terrors of the thick darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Drought and heat consume the snow waters:
So doth Sheol those that have sinned.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He devoureth the barren that beareth not,
And doeth not good to the widow.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yet God preserveth the mighty by his power:
He riseth up that hath no assurance of life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God giveth them to be in security, and they rest thereon;
And his eyes are upon their ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And if it be not so now, who will prove me a liar,
And make my speech nothing worth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Dominion and fear are with him;
He maketh peace in his high places.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is there any number of his armies?
And upon whom doth not his light arise?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How then can man be just with God?
Or how can he be clean that is born of a woman?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, even the moon hath no brightness,
And the stars are not pure in his sight:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much less man, that is a worm!
And the son of man, that is a worm!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How hast thou helped him that is without power!
How hast thou saved the arm that hath no strength!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How hast thou counselled him that hath no wisdom,
And plentifully declared sound knowledge!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To whom hast thou uttered words?
And whose spirit came forth from thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They that are deceased tremble
Beneath the waters and the inhabitants thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Sheol is naked before God,
And Abaddon hath no covering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stretcheth out the north over empty space,
And hangeth the earth upon nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds;
And the cloud is not rent under them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He incloseth the face of his throne,
And spreadeth his cloud upon it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath described a boundary upon the face of the waters,
Unto the confines of light and darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The pillars of heaven tremble
And are astonished at his rebuke.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He stirreth up the sea with his power,
And by his understanding he smiteth through Rahab.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By his Spirit the heavens are garnished;
His hand hath pierced the swift serpent.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lo, these are but the outskirts of his ways:
And how small a whisper do we hear of him!
But the thunder of his power who can understand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Job again took up his parable, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As God liveth, who hath taken away my right,
And the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(For my life is yet whole in me,
And the spirit of God is in my nostrils);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely my lips shall not speak unrighteousness,
Neither shall my tongue utter deceit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Far be it from me that I should justify you:
Till I die I will not put away mine integrity from me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go:
My heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let mine enemy be as the wicked,
And let him that riseth up against me be as the unrighteous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For what is the hope of the godless, though he get him gain,
When God taketh away his soul?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will God hear his cry,
When trouble cometh upon him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will he delight himself in the Almighty,
And call upon God at all times?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will teach you concerning the hand of God;
That which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it;
Why then are ye become altogether vain?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This is the portion of a wicked man with God,
And the heritage of oppressors, which they receive from the Almighty:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword;
And his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Those that remain of him shall be buried in death,
And his widows shall make no lamentation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Though he heap up silver as the dust,
And prepare raiment as the clay;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on,
And the innocent shall divide the silver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He buildeth his house as the moth,
And as a booth which the keeper maketh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He lieth down rich, but he shall not be gathered to his fathers;
He openeth his eyes, and he is not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Terrors overtake him like waters;
A tempest stealeth him away in the night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth;
And it sweepeth him out of his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God shall hurl at him, and not spare:
He would fain flee out of his hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Men shall clap their hands at him,
And shall hiss him out of his place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely there is a mine for silver,
And a place for gold which they refine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Iron is taken out of the earth,
And copper is molten out of the stone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Man setteth an end to darkness,
And searcheth out, to the furthest bound,
The stones of obscurity and of thick darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
As for the earth, out of it cometh bread;
And underneath it is turned up as it were by fire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The stones thereof are the place of sapphires,
And it hath dust of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That path no bird of prey knoweth,
Neither hath the falcon’s eye seen it:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The proud beasts have not trodden it,
Nor hath the fierce lion passed thereby.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He putteth forth his hand upon the flinty rock;
He overturneth the mountains by the roots.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He cutteth out channels among the rocks;
And his eye seeth every precious thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He bindeth the streams that they trickle not;
And the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But where shall wisdom be found?
And where is the place of understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Man knoweth not the price thereof;
Neither is it found in the land of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The deep saith, It is not in me;
And the sea saith, It is not with me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It cannot be gotten for gold,
Neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir,
With the precious onyx, or the sapphire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gold and glass cannot equal it,
Neither shall it be exchanged for jewels of fine gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
No mention shall be made of coral or of crystal:
Yea, the price of wisdom is above rubies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it,
Neither shall it be valued with pure gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whence then cometh wisdom?
And where is the place of understanding?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living,
And kept close from the birds of the heavens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Destruction and Death say,
We have heard a rumor thereof with our ears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
God understandeth the way thereof,
And he knoweth the place thereof.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he looketh to the ends of the earth,
And seeth under the whole heaven;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To make a weight for the wind:
Yea, he meteth out the waters by measure.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
