When he made a decree for the rain,
And a way for the lightning of the thunder;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then did he see it, and declare it;
He established it, yea, and searched it out.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: And Job again took up his parable, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that I were as in the months of old,
As in the days when God watched over me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When his lamp shined upon my head,
And by his light I walked through darkness;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As I was in the ripeness of my days,
When the friendship of God was upon my tent;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the Almighty was yet with me,
And my children were about me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When my steps were washed with butter,
And the rock poured me out streams of oil!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I went forth to the gate unto the city,
When I prepared my seat in the street,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The young men saw me and hid themselves,
And the aged rose up and stood;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The princes refrained from talking,
And laid their hand on their mouth;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The voice of the nobles was hushed,
And their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For when the ear heard me, then it blessed me;
And when the eye saw me, it gave witness unto me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because I delivered the poor that cried,
The fatherless also, that had none to help him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me;
And I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I put on righteousness, and it clothed me:
My justice was as a robe and a diadem.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was eyes to the blind,
And feet was I to the lame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I was a father to the needy:
And the cause of him that I knew not I searched out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And I brake the jaws of the unrighteous,
And plucked the prey out of his teeth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then I said, I shall die in my nest,
And I shall multiply my days as the sand:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My root is spread out to the waters,
And the dew lieth all night upon my branch:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My glory is fresh in me,
And my bow is renewed in my hand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Unto me men gave ear, and waited,
And kept silence for my counsel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
After my words they spake not again;
And my speech distilled upon them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And they waited for me as for the rain;
And they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I smiled on them, when they had no confidence;
And the light of my countenance they cast not down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I chose out their way, and sat as chief,
And dwelt as a king in the army,
As one that comforteth the mourners.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now they that are younger than I have me in derision,
Whose fathers I disdained to set with the dogs of my flock.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, the strength of their hands, whereto should it profit me?
Men in whom ripe age is perished.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are gaunt with want and famine;
They gnaw the dry ground, in the gloom of wasteness and desolation.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They pluck salt-wort by the bushes;
And the roots of the broom are their food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are driven forth from the midst of men;
They cry after them as after a thief;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that they dwell in frightful valleys,
In holes of the earth and of the rocks.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Among the bushes they bray;
Under the nettles they are gathered together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are children of fools, yea, children of base men;
They were scourged out of the land.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And now I am become their song,
Yea, I am a byword unto them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They abhor me, they stand aloof from me,
And spare not to spit in my face.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he hath loosed his cord, and afflicted me;
And they have cast off the bridle before me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
They mar my path,
They set forward my calamity,
Even men that have no helper.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As through a wide breach they come:
In the midst of the ruin they roll themselves upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
And now my soul is poured out within me;
Days of affliction have taken hold upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In the night season my bones are pierced in me,
And the pains that gnaw me take no rest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By God’s great force is my garment disfigured;
It bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath cast me into the mire,
And I am become like dust and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I cry unto thee, and thou dost not answer me:
I stand up, and thou gazest at me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou art turned to be cruel to me;
With the might of thy hand thou persecutest me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thou liftest me up to the wind, thou causest me to ride upon it;
And thou dissolvest me in the storm.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I know that thou wilt bring me to death,
And to the house appointed for all living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Howbeit doth not one stretch out the hand in his fall?
Or in his calamity therefore cry for help?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Did not I weep for him that was in trouble?
Was not my soul grieved for the needy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I looked for good, then evil came;
And when I waited for light, there came darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My heart is troubled, and resteth not;
Days of affliction are come upon me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I go mourning without the sun:
I stand up in the assembly, and cry for help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am a brother to jackals,
And a companion to ostriches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My skin is black, and falleth from me,
And my bones are burned with heat.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore is my harp turned to mourning,
And my pipe into the voice of them that weep.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I made a covenant with mine eyes;
How then should I look upon a virgin?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For what is the portion from God above,
And the heritage from the Almighty on high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it not calamity to the unrighteous,
And disaster to the workers of iniquity?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Doth not he see my ways,
And number all my steps?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have walked with falsehood,
And my foot hath hasted to deceit
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(Let me be weighed in an even balance,
That God may know mine integrity);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If my step hath turned out of the way,
And my heart walked after mine eyes,
And if any spot hath cleaved to my hands:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then let me sow, and let another eat;
Yea, let the produce of my field be rooted out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If my heart hath been enticed unto a woman,
And I have laid wait at my neighbor’s door;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then let my wife grind unto another,
And let others bow down upon her.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For that were a heinous crime;
Yea, it were an iniquity to be punished by the judges:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For it is a fire that consumeth unto Destruction,
And would root out all mine increase.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have despised the cause of my man-servant or of my maid-servant,
When they contended with me;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What then shall I do when God riseth up?
And when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Did not he that made me in the womb make him?
And did not one fashion us in the womb?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have withheld the poor from their desire,
Or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or have eaten my morsel alone,
And the fatherless hath not eaten thereof
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(Nay, from my youth he grew up with me as with a father,
And her have I guided from my mother’s womb);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have seen any perish for want of clothing,
Or that the needy had no covering;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If his loins have not blessed me,
And if he hath not been warmed with the fleece of my sheep;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless,
Because I saw my help in the gate:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then let my shoulder fall from the shoulder-blade,
And mine arm be broken from the bone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For calamity from God is a terror to me,
And by reason of his majesty I can do nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have made gold my hope,
And have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have rejoiced because my wealth was great,
And because my hand had gotten much;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have beheld the sun when it shined,
Or the moon walking in brightness,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And my heart hath been secretly enticed,
And my mouth hath kissed my hand:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judges;
For I should have denied the God that is above.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me,
Or lifted up myself when evil found him
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(Yea, I have not suffered my mouth to sin
By asking his life with a curse);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If the men of my tent have not said,
Who can find one that hath not been filled with his meat?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
(The sojourner hath not lodged in the street;
But I have opened my doors to the traveller);
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If like Adam I have covered my transgressions,
By hiding mine iniquity in my bosom,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because I feared the great multitude,
And the contempt of families terrified me,
So that I kept silence, and went not out of the door—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Oh that I had one to hear me!
(Lo, here is my signature, let the Almighty answer me)
And that I had the indictment which mine adversary hath written!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely I would carry it upon my shoulder;
I would bind it unto me as a crown:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I would declare unto him the number of my steps;
As a prince would I go near unto him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If my land crieth out against me,
And the furrows thereof weep together;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money,
Or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let thistles grow instead of wheat,
And cockle instead of barley.
The words of Job are ended.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now Elihu had waited to speak unto Job, because they were elder than he.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And when Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, his wrath was kindled.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
I said, Days should speak,
And multitude of years should teach wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But there is a spirit in man,
And the breath of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is not the great that are wise,
Nor the aged that understand justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore I said, Hearken to me;
I also will show mine opinion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I waited for your words,
I listened for your reasonings,
Whilst ye searched out what to say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, I attended unto you,
And, behold, there was none that convinced Job,
Or that answered his words, among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Beware lest ye say, We have found wisdom;
God may vanquish him, not man:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he hath not directed his words against me;
Neither will I answer him with your speeches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are amazed, they answer no more:
They have not a word to say.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And shall I wait, because they speak not,
Because they stand still, and answer no more?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I also will answer my part,
I also will show mine opinion.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I am full of words;
The spirit within me constraineth me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, my breast is as wine which hath no vent;
Like new wine-skins it is ready to burst.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will speak, that I may be refreshed;
I will open my lips and answer.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let me not, I pray you, respect any man’s person;
Neither will I give flattering titles unto any man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For I know not to give flattering titles;
Else would my Maker soon take me away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Howbeit, Job, I pray thee, hear my speech,
And hearken to all my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold now, I have opened my mouth;
My tongue hath spoken in my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
My words shall utter the uprightness of my heart;
And that which my lips know they shall speak sincerely.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The Spirit of God hath made me,
And the breath of the Almighty giveth me life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thou canst, answer thou me;
Set thy words in order before me, stand forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I am toward God even as thou art:
I also am formed out of the clay.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid,
Neither shall my pressure be heavy upon thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely thou hast spoken in my hearing,
And I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I am clean, without transgression;
I am innocent, neither is there iniquity in me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, he findeth occasions against me,
He counteth me for his enemy;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He putteth my feet in the stocks,
He marketh all my paths.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I will answer thee, in this thou art not just;
For God is greater than man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Why dost thou strive against him,
For that he giveth not account of any of his matters?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For God speaketh once,
Yea twice, though man regardeth it not.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then he openeth the ears of men,
And sealeth their instruction,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That he may withdraw man from his purpose,
And hide pride from man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He keepeth back his soul from the pit,
And his life from perishing by the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is chastened also with pain upon his bed,
And with continual strife in his bones;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that his life abhorreth bread,
And his soul dainty food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen;
And his bones that were not seen stick out.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, his soul draweth near unto the pit,
And his life to the destroyers.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Then God is gracious unto him, and saith,
Deliver him from going down to the pit,
I have found a ransom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His flesh shall be fresher than a child’s;
He returneth to the days of his youth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He prayeth unto God, and he is favorable unto him,
So that he seeth his face with joy:
And he restoreth unto man his righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He singeth before men, and saith,
I have sinned, and perverted that which was right,
And it profited me not:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He hath redeemed my soul from going into the pit,
And my life shall behold the light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lo, all these things doth God work,
Twice, yea thrice, with a man,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To bring back his soul from the pit,
That he may be enlightened with the light of the living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me:
Hold thy peace, and I will speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thou hast anything to say, answer me:
Speak, for I desire to justify thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If not, hearken thou unto me:
Hold thy peace, and I will teach thee wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Elihu answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear my words, ye wise men;
And give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the ear trieth words,
As the palate tasteth food.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Let us choose for us that which is right:
Let us know among ourselves what is good.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For Job hath said, I am righteous,
And God hath taken away my right:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Notwithstanding my right I am accounted a liar;
My wound is incurable, though I am without transgression.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What man is like Job,
Who drinketh up scoffing like water,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who goeth in company with the workers of iniquity,
And walketh with wicked men?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing
That he should delight himself with God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding:
Far be it from God, that he should do wickedness,
And from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For the work of a man will he render unto him,
And cause every man to find according to his ways.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, of a surety, God will not do wickedly,
Neither will the Almighty pervert justice.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who gave him a charge over the earth?
Or who hath disposed the whole world?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If he set his heart upon himself,
If he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All flesh shall perish together,
And man shall turn again unto dust.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If now thou hast understanding, hear this:
Hearken to the voice of my words.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall even one that hateth justice govern?
And wilt thou condemn him that is righteous and mighty?—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Him that saith to a king, Thou art vile,
Or to nobles, Ye are wicked;
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
For his eyes are upon the ways of a man,
And he seeth all his goings.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There is no darkness, nor thick gloom,
Where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he needeth not further to consider a man,
That he should go before God in judgment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He breaketh in pieces mighty men in ways past finding out,
And setteth others in their stead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore he taketh knowledge of their works;
And he overturneth them in the night, so that they are destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He striketh them as wicked men
In the open sight of others;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because they turned aside from following him,
And would not have regard in any of his ways:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
So that they caused the cry of the poor to come unto him,
And he heard the cry of the afflicted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he giveth quietness, who then can condemn?
And when he hideth his face, who then can behold him?
Alike whether it be done unto a nation, or unto a man:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That the godless man reign not,
That there be none to ensnare the people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For hath any said unto God,
I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That which I see not teach thou me:
If I have done iniquity, I will do it no more?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall his recompense be as thou wilt, that thou refusest it?
For thou must choose, and not I:
Therefore speak what thou knowest.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Men of understanding will say unto me,
Yea, every wise man that heareth me:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Job speaketh without knowledge,
And his words are without wisdom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Would that Job were tried unto the end,
Because of his answering like wicked men.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Elihu answered and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thinkest thou this to be thy right,
Or sayest thou, My righteousness is more than God’s,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That thou sayest, What advantage will it be unto thee?
And, What profit shall I have, more than if I had sinned?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will answer thee,
And thy companions with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look unto the heavens, and see;
And behold the skies, which are higher than thou.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thou hast sinned, what effectest thou against him?
And if thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If thou be righteous, what givest thou him?
Or what receiveth he of thy hand?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art;
And thy righteousness may profit a son of man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By reason of the multitude of oppressions they cry out;
They cry for help by reason of the arm of the mighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But none saith, Where is God my Maker,
Who giveth songs in the night,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth,
And maketh us wiser than the birds of the heavens?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
There they cry, but none giveth answer,
Because of the pride of evil men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely God will not hear an empty cry,
Neither will the Almighty regard it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How much less when thou sayest thou beholdest him not,
The cause is before him, and thou waitest for him!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But now, because he hath not visited in his anger,
Neither doth he greatly regard arrogance;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vanity;
He multiplieth words without knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Elihu also proceeded, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Suffer me a little, and I will show thee;
For I have yet somewhat to say on God’s behalf.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will fetch my knowledge from afar,
And will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For truly my words are not false:
One that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any:
He is mighty in strength of understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He preserveth not the life of the wicked,
But giveth to the afflicted their right.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous:
But with kings upon the throne
He setteth them for ever, and they are exalted.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And if they be bound in fetters,
And be taken in the cords of affliction;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then he showeth them their work,
And their transgressions, that they have behaved themselves proudly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He openeth also their ear to instruction,
And commandeth that they return from iniquity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If they hearken and serve him,
They shall spend their days in prosperity,
And their years in pleasures.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But if they hearken not, they shall perish by the sword,
And they shall die without knowledge.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
But they that are godless in heart lay up anger:
They cry not for help when he bindeth them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They die in youth,
And their life perisheth among the unclean.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He delivereth the afflicted by their affliction,
And openeth their ear in oppression.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
But thou art full of the judgment of the wicked:
Judgment and justice take hold on thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For let not wrath stir thee up against chastisements;
Neither let the greatness of the ransom turn thee aside.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will thy cry avail, that thou be not in distress,
Or all the forces of thy strength?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Desire not the night,
When peoples are cut off in their place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Take heed, regard not iniquity:
For this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, God doeth loftily in his power:
Who is a teacher like unto him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who hath enjoined him his way?
Or who can say, Thou hast wrought unrighteousness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Remember that thou magnify his work,
Whereof men have sung.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
All men have looked thereon;
Man beholdeth it afar off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, God is great, and we know him not;
The number of his years is unsearchable.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he draweth up the drops of water,
Which distil in rain from his vapor,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Which the skies pour down
And drop upon man abundantly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, can any understand the spreadings of the clouds,
The thunderings of his pavilion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, he spreadeth his light around him;
And he covereth the bottom of the sea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For by these he judgeth the peoples;
He giveth food in abundance.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He covereth his hands with the lightning,
And giveth it a charge that it strike the mark.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The noise thereof telleth concerning him,
The cattle also concerning the storm that cometh up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, at this my heart trembleth,
And is moved out of its place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, oh, hear the noise of his voice,
And the sound that goeth out of his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He sendeth it forth under the whole heaven,
And his lightning unto the ends of the earth.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
God thundereth marvellously with his voice;
Great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
He sealeth up the hand of every man,
That all men whom he hath made may know it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then the beasts go into coverts,
And remain in their dens.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of the chamber of the south cometh the storm,
And cold out of the north.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By the breath of God ice is given;
And the breadth of the waters is straitened.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Yea, he ladeth the thick cloud with moisture;
He spreadeth abroad the cloud of his lightning:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And it is turned round about by his guidance,
That they may do whatsoever he commandeth them
Upon the face of the habitable world,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whether it be for correction, or for his land,
Or for lovingkindness, that he cause it to come.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hearken unto this, O Job:
Stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Dost thou know how God layeth his charge upon them,
And causeth the lightning of his cloud to shine?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds,
The wondrous works of him who is perfect in knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
How thy garments are warm,
When the earth is still by reason of the south wind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canst thou with him spread out the sky,
Which is strong as a molten mirror?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Teach us what we shall say unto him;
For we cannot set our speech in order by reason of darkness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall it be told him that I would speak?
Or should a man wish that he were swallowed up?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And now men see not the light which is bright in the skies;
But the wind passeth, and cleareth them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of the north cometh golden splendor:
God hath upon him terrible majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text:
Men do therefore fear him:
He regardeth not any that are wise of heart.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehovah answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is this that darkeneth counsel
By words without knowledge?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gird up now thy loins like a man;
For I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth?
Declare, if thou hast understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who determined the measures thereof, if thou knowest?
Or who stretched the line upon it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whereupon were the foundations thereof fastened?
Or who laid the corner-stone thereof,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the morning stars sang together,
And all the sons of God shouted for joy?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or who shut up the sea with doors,
When it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When I made clouds the garment thereof,
And thick darkness a swaddling-band for it,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And marked out for it my bound,
And set bars and doors,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further;
And here shall thy proud waves be stayed?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days began,
And caused the dayspring to know its place;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That it might take hold of the ends of the earth,
And the wicked be shaken out of it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
It is changed as clay under the seal;
And all things stand forth as a garment:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And from the wicked their light is withholden,
And the high arm is broken.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea?
Or hast thou walked in the recesses of the deep?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Have the gates of death been revealed unto thee?
Or hast thou seen the gates of the shadow of death?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hast thou comprehended the earth in its breadth?
Declare, if thou knowest it all.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Where is the way to the dwelling of light?
And as for darkness, where is the place thereof,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof,
And that thou shouldest discern the paths to the house thereof?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Doubtless, thou knowest, for thou wast then born,
And the number of thy days is great!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hast thou entered the treasuries of the snow,
Or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Which I have reserved against the time of trouble,
Against the day of battle and war?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
By what way is the light parted,
Or the east wind scattered upon the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who hath cleft a channel for the waterflood,
Or the way for the lightning of the thunder;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To cause it to rain on a land where no man is;
On the wilderness, wherein there is no man;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
To satisfy the waste and desolate ground,
And to cause the tender grass to spring forth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hath the rain a father?
Or who hath begotten the drops of dew?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of whose womb came the ice?
And the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The waters hide themselves and become like stone,
And the face of the deep is frozen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canst thou bind the cluster of the Pleiades,
Or loose the bands of Orion?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canst thou lead forth the Mazzaroth in their season?
Or canst thou guide the Bear with her train?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Knowest thou the ordinances of the heavens?
Canst thou establish the dominion thereof in the earth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canst thou lift up thy voice to the clouds,
That abundance of waters may cover thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canst thou send forth lightnings, that they may go,
And say unto thee, Here we are?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who hath put wisdom in the inward parts?
Or who hath given understanding to the mind?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can number the clouds by wisdom?
Or who can pour out the bottles of heaven,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When the dust runneth into a mass,
And the clods cleave fast together?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canst thou hunt the prey for the lioness,
Or satisfy the appetite of the young lions,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When they couch in their dens,
And abide in the covert to lie in wait?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who provideth for the raven his prey,
When his young ones cry unto God,
And wander for lack of food?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Knowest thou the time when the wild goats of the rock bring forth?
Or canst thou mark when the hinds do calve?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canst thou number the months that they fulfil?
Or knowest thou the time when they bring forth?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They bow themselves, they bring forth their young,
They cast out their pains.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Their young ones become strong, they grow up in the open field;
They go forth, and return not again.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who hath sent out the wild ass free?
Or who hath loosed the bonds of the swift ass,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Whose home I have made the wilderness,
And the salt land his dwelling-place?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He scorneth the tumult of the city,
Neither heareth he the shoutings of the driver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The range of the mountains is his pasture,
And he searcheth after every green thing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will the wild-ox be content to serve thee?
Or will he abide by thy crib?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canst thou bind the wild-ox with his band in the furrow?
Or will he harrow the valleys after thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wilt thou trust him, because his strength is great?
Or wilt thou leave to him thy labor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wilt thou confide in him, that he will bring home thy seed,
And gather the grain of thy threshing-floor?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The wings of the ostrich wave proudly;
But are they the pinions and plumage of love?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For she leaveth her eggs on the earth,
And warmeth them in the dust,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
And forgetteth that the foot may crush them,
Or that the wild beast may trample them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
She dealeth hardly with her young ones, as if they were not hers:
Though her labor be in vain, she is without fear;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Because God hath deprived her of wisdom,
Neither hath he imparted to her understanding.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What time she lifteth up herself on high,
She scorneth the horse and his rider.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hast thou given the horse his might?
Hast thou clothed his neck with the quivering mane?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hast thou made him to leap as a locust?
The glory of his snorting is terrible.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He paweth in the valley, and rejoiceth in his strength:
He goeth out to meet the armed men.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He mocketh at fear, and is not dismayed;
Neither turneth he back from the sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The quiver rattleth against him,
The flashing spear and the javelin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He swalloweth the ground with fierceness and rage;
Neither believeth he that it is the voice of the trumpet.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As oft as the trumpet soundeth he saith, Aha!
And he smelleth the battle afar off,
The thunder of the captains, and the shouting.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it by thy wisdom that the hawk soareth,
And stretcheth her wings toward the south?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Is it at thy command that the eagle mounteth up,
And maketh her nest on high?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
On the cliff she dwelleth, and maketh her home,
Upon the point of the cliff, and the stronghold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
From thence she spieth out the prey;
Her eyes behold it afar off.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Her young ones also suck up blood:
And where the slain are, there is she.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Moreover Jehovah answered Job, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall he that cavilleth contend with the Almighty?
He that argueth with God, let him answer it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered Jehovah, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, I am of small account; what shall I answer thee?
I lay my hand upon my mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Once have I spoken, and I will not answer;
Yea, twice, but I will proceed no further.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Jehovah answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Gird up thy loins now like a man:
I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wilt thou even annul my judgment?
Wilt thou condemn me, that thou mayest be justified?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Or hast thou an arm like God?
And canst thou thunder with a voice like him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Deck thyself now with excellency and dignity;
And array thyself with honor and majesty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Pour forth the overflowings of thine anger;
And look upon every one that is proud, and abase him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Look on every one that is proud, and bring him low;
And tread down the wicked where they stand.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hide them in the dust together;
Bind their faces in the hidden place.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Then will I also confess of thee
That thine own right hand can save thee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold now, behemoth, which I made as well as thee;
He eateth grass as an ox.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lo now, his strength is in his loins,
And his force is in the muscles of his belly.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He moveth his tail like a cedar:
The sinews of his thighs are knit together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His bones are as tubes of brass;
His limbs are like bars of iron.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He is the chief of the ways of God:
He only that made him giveth him his sword.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Surely the mountains bring him forth food,
Where all the beasts of the field do play.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He lieth under the lotus-trees,
In the covert of the reed, and the fen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The lotus-trees cover him with their shade;
The willows of the brook compass him about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, if a river overflow, he trembleth not;
He is confident, though a Jordan swell even to his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Shall any take him when he is on the watch,
Or pierce through his nose with a snare?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canst thou draw out leviathan with a fishhook?
Or press down his tongue with a cord?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canst thou put a rope into his nose?
Or pierce his jaw through with a hook?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will he make many supplications unto thee?
Or will he speak soft words unto thee?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will he make a covenant with thee,
That thou shouldest take him for a servant for ever?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wilt thou play with him as with a bird?
Or wilt thou bind him for thy maidens?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Will the bands of fishermen make traffic of him?
Will they part him among the merchants?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Canst thou fill his skin with barbed irons,
Or his head with fish-spears?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Lay thy hand upon him;
Remember the battle, and do so no more.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Behold, the hope of him is in vain:
Will not one be cast down even at the sight of him?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
None is so fierce that he dare stir him up;
Who then is he that can stand before me?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who hath first given unto me, that I should repay him?
Whatsoever is under the whole heaven is mine.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will not keep silence concerning his limbs,
Nor his mighty strength, nor his goodly frame.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can strip off his outer garment?
Who shall come within his jaws?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who can open the doors of his face?
Round about his teeth is terror.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His strong scales are his pride,
Shut up together as with a close seal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
One is so near to another,
That no air can come between them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
They are joined one to another;
They stick together, so that they cannot be sundered.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His sneezings flash forth light,
And his eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of his mouth go burning torches,
And sparks of fire leap forth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Out of his nostrils a smoke goeth,
As of a boiling pot and burning rushes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His breath kindleth coals,
And a flame goeth forth from his mouth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
In his neck abideth strength,
And terror danceth before him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The flakes of his flesh are joined together:
They are firm upon him; they cannot be moved.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His heart is as firm as a stone;
Yea, firm as the nether millstone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
When he raiseth himself up, the mighty are afraid:
By reason of consternation they are beside themselves.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
If one lay at him with the sword, it cannot avail;
Nor the spear, the dart, nor the pointed shaft.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He counteth iron as straw,
And brass as rotten wood.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
The arrow cannot make him flee:
Sling-stones are turned with him into stubble.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Clubs are counted as stubble:
He laugheth at the rushing of the javelin.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
His underparts are like sharp potsherds:
He spreadeth as it were a threshing-wain upon the mire.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He maketh the deep to boil like a pot:
He maketh the sea like a pot of ointment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He maketh a path to shine after him;
One would think the deep to be hoary.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Upon earth there is not his like,
That is made without fear.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
He beholdeth everything that is high:
He is king over all the sons of pride.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then Job answered Jehovah, and said,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I know that thou canst do all things,
And that no purpose of thine can be restrained.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Who is this that hideth counsel without knowledge?
Therefore have I uttered that which I understood not,
Things too wonderful for me, which I knew not.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Hear, I beseech thee, and I will speak;
I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I had heard of thee by the hearing of the ear;
But now mine eye seeth thee:
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Wherefore I abhor myself,
And repent in dust and ashes.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And it was so, that, after Jehovah had spoken these words unto Job, Jehovah said to Eliphaz the Temanite, My wrath is kindled against thee, and against thy two friends; for ye have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now therefore, take unto you seven bullocks and seven rams, and go to my servant Job, and offer up for yourselves a burnt-offering; and my servant Job shall pray for you; for him will I accept, that I deal not with you after your folly; for ye have not spoken of me the thing that is right, as my servant Job hath.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Eliphaz the Temanite and Bildad the Shuhite and Zophar the Naamathite went, and did according as Jehovah commanded them: and Jehovah accepted Job.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And Jehovah turned the captivity of Job, when he prayed for his friends: and Jehovah gave Job twice as much as he had before.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then came there unto him all his brethren, and all his sisters, and all they that had been of his acquaintance before, and did eat bread with him in his house: and they bemoaned him, and comforted him concerning all the evil that Jehovah had brought upon him: every man also gave him a piece of money, and every one a ring of gold.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Jehovah blessed the latter end of Job more than his beginning: and he had fourteen thousand sheep, and six thousand camels, and a thousand yoke of oxen, and a thousand she-asses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He had also seven sons and three daughters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And he called the name of the first, Jemimah; and the name of the second, Keziah; and the name of the third, Keren-happuch.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And in all the land were no women found so fair as the daughters of Job: and their father gave them inheritance among their brethren.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And after this Job lived a hundred and forty years, and saw his sons, and his sons’ sons, even four generations.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So Job died, being old and full of days.
verses.speaker: Narrator
